content.description: Unprotected face climbing, with the crux well above the ground, leads to a chimney and hand crack above.
content.location: Just right of Creditor's Claim on the right end of the wall, this climb starts below and a bit to the right of an obvious chimney.

climbs.name: Overdraft
climbs.fa: (TR) Todd Swain, December 1988,  FL: Alan Bartlett, May 1996

content.description:
Climb

Chapter 7

to about the halfway point, place some gear, and then cut left into runout, grainy scoops leading to the top.

Although

the upper portion of this route is runout, the crux comes soon after leaving the crack and as long as you keep a cool head it's not too bad.

Descend

down the left side of the formation.

This route is on the left side of the Bankrupt Wall. There are two sections that I would call 10b. The moves to pull yourself up into the scoop at the bottom and the last couple of moves in the thin crack. Both cruxes protect well. Fun and balancy.
content.protection: Nuts and small cams to #1 on route.  Gear anchor at top could use #2 cam.

climbs.name: Dollars and Sense
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Patty Kline, October 2004

content.description: Climb the narrow slab between Chapter 7 and Creditor's Claim, moving right below the patina section.
content.protection: Some large cams (#3 and #4 camalots) are useful for the TR rig.

content.description: I thought this route was really fun.  It has a little bit of everything.  Funky face moves, smearing, wide hand jamming at the crux, and good hands toward the top continuing into a seam.
content.protection: Protects with nuts and cams up to #4.  The #4 protects the crux.

content.description: This climb is the left crack of the right three cracks on the Bankrupt Wall.  The first half is 5.6 slab to get up to the crack.  The crack takes only big gear.  It has some pretty fun moves, but it proved to be sketchy for a 10a leader that only brought up to a camalot #3.  IMO it is better to set up a toprope or just climb Creditors Claim just to the right of it.
content.protection: No pro for the first half of the route.  The second half protects with a #3 cam and bigger if you want to put more than one piect in.

content.description:
Climb the smooth face just right of

Insolvent

and then cut left to join that route just below the top. Not overly remarkable but something to do after leading Insolvent.
